ProcedureHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PROC HPFESMSPEC options ; 
    ESM options ;  

The HPFESMSPEC procedure creates model specifications files for exponential
smoothing models (ESM). 

You can specify many types of exponential models with this procedure. In
particular, any model that can be analyzed using the HPF procedure can be
specified.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: LABEL="specification label" ] 
      
Specifies a descriptive label for the model specification to be stored in the
SAS catalog or external file reference.

[Syntax: NAME=SAS-name ] 
      
Names the model specification to be stored in the SAS catalog or external file
reference. The NAME= option can also be specified as SPECNAME=.

[Syntax: REPOSITORY=SAS-catalog-name | SAS-file-reference ] 
      
Names the SAS catalog or external file reference to contain the model
specification. The REPOSITORY= option can also be specified as
MODELREPOSITORY=, MODELREP=, or REP=.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: ESM options ;
      
The ESM statement is used to specify an exponential smoothing model.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: CRITERION=option ] 
      
Specifies the model selection criterion (statistic of fit) to be used to select
from several candidate models.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip12: Mean absolute error percent of standard deviation
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip13: Median absolute error percent of standard deviation
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip14: Geometric mean absolute error percent of standard deviation
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip18: Symmetric mean absolute predictive percent error
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip20: Geometric mean absolute predictive percent error
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip26: Geometric mean absolute symmetric percent error

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: DAMPPARM=number ] 
      
Specifies the damping weight parameter initial value.

[Syntax: DAMPREST=(number, number ) ] 
      
Specifies the damping weight parameter restrictions.

[Syntax: LEVELPARM=number ] 
      
Specifies the level weight parameter initial value.

[Syntax: LEVELREST=(number, number ) ] 
      
Specifies the level weight parameter restrictions.

[Syntax: MEDIAN ] 
      
Specifies that the median forecast values be estimated. Forecasts can be based
on the mean or median.

[Syntax: METHOD=method-name ] 
      
Specifies the forecasting model to be used to forecast the time series.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip10: Best candidate smoothing model (SIMPLE, DOUBLE, LINEAR, DAMPTREND), (ADDSEASONAL,  ADDWINTERS, WINTERS)
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip11: Best candidate nonseasonal smoothing model (SIMPLE, DOUBLE, LINEAR, DAMPTREND)
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip12: Best candidate seasonal smoothing model (ADDSEASONAL, ADDWINTERS, WINTERS)

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: NOEST ] 
      
Specifies that the smoothing model parameters are fixed values.

[Syntax: NOSTABLE ] 
      
Specifies that the smoothing model parameters are not restricted to the
additive invertible region of the parameter space.

[Syntax: SEASONPARM=number ] 
      
Specifies the season weight parameter initial value.

[Syntax: SEASONREST=(number, number ) ] 
      
Specifies the season weight parameter restrictions.

[Syntax: TRANSFORM=option ] 
      
Specifies the time series transformation to be applied to the time series.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: No transformation. This option is the default.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Box-Cox transformation with parameter number where number is between –5 and 5
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Automatically choose between NONE and LOG based on model selection criteria.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: TRENDPARM=number ] 
      
Specifies the trend weight parameter initial value.

[Syntax: TRENDREST=(number, number ) ] 
      
Specifies the trend weight parameter restrictions.
